trans-unit.source: Defines a polygon-shaped hot spot region in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.
This class defines a polygon-shaped hot spot region in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> is useful for defining irregularly shaped hot spot regions in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control.
For example, you can use it to define individual regions within a geographical map.

To define the region of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot>, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.Coordinates%2A> property to a string that specifies the coordinates of each vertex of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object.
A polygon vertex is a point at which two polygon edges meet.
When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object is clicked, the page navigates to a URL, generates a post back to the server, or does nothing.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A> property specifies this behavior.

To navigate to a URL, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A> property to `HotSpotMode.Navigate`, and use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.NavigateUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to navigate to.

To post back to the server, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A> property to `HotSpotMode.PostBack`, and use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.PostBackValue%2A> property to specify a name for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object.
This name will be passed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMapEventArgs> event data when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> is clicked.
If you want the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object to have no behavior, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A> property to `HotSpotMode.Inactive`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> class.
A string of coordinates that represents the vertexes of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot"></xref> object.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.Coordinates%2A> property to specify the coordinates of the vertexes of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object.
A polygon vertex is a point at which two polygon edges meet.
The string that you specify must be formatted with each coordinate separated by a comma.
Each vertex that you specify must have both an x- coordinate and a y-coordinate.
For example, the string "128,185,335,157,510,224,510,383,228,383" defines a polygon hot spot with five vertexes.
The x-coordinate of the first vertex is 128.
The y-coordinate of the first vertex is 185.
A string that represents the coordinates of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot"></xref> object's vertexes.
Returns a string that represents the coordinates of the vertexes of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.GetCoordinates%2A> method returns a string that represents the coordinates of the vertexes of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object.
The string this method returns is the current value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.Coordinates%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.GetCoordinates%2A> method is used internally by ASP.NET to get the text to use for the coordinates of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> when it is rendered.
The string that is returned is specific to the browser and markup language.
A string that represents the coordinates of the vertexes of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot"></xref> object.
The default value is an empty string ("").
